channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump plans to pardon former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez
item.description: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez was convicted for drug trafficking and weapons charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

item.title: 7/28/2024: Quantum Computing; Knife; College of Magic
item.description: First, a look inside the quantum computer race. Then, Salman Rushdie: The 2024 60 Minutes Interview. And, going inside the College of Magic.

item.title: Russian drone strikes hit Kyiv residential areas despite peace moves
item.description: The attack on Ukraine's capital early on Saturday killed one person and injured seven, city officials said.

item.title: Northwestern to pay $75M to feds to settle antisemitism claims, restore funds
item.description: Northwestern University will pay $75 million to the federal government over the next three years to end an antisemitism investigation by the Trump adm...

item.title: Airbus software issue may cause flight delays during busy Thanksgiving weekend
item.description: Airbus recommended an emergency software update to the A320 family of aircraft.

item.title: 11/28: CBS Evening News
item.description: President Trump calls for a major immigration overhaul; Airlines scramble to update software problem.

item.title: US halts all asylum claim decisions in wake of National Guard shooting
item.description: The directive comes hours after President Trump said the US will pause migration from "third-world countries".

item.title: How Trump's pledge to tackle Sudan atrocities could play out
item.description: The war is being fuelled by regional powers and the US president may have some leverage over them.

item.title: US halts all asylum decisions as suspect in shooting of National Guard members faces murder charge

item.title: Planes grounded after Airbus discovers solar radiation could impact systems
item.description: The issue is thought to affect 6,000 planes, which will need to undergo an urgent software update or have computers replaced.

item.title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.

item.title: Trump officials and judge face off over flights to El Salvador in rare, high-stakes contempt probe
Investigators probe suspect's background in D.C. National Guard shooting
item.description: A National Guard member died in the wake of the shooting near the White House, President Trump said.

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site

item.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns as Ukraine corruption investigations widen

item.title: Trump administration pausing all asylum decisions after National Guard shooting

item.title: Winter storm warnings stretch across the northern US, bringing snow, cold and risky conditions
